printer.desc: My current 3D Printer is an Anet A8. I bought it in 2018 and heavily customized it since then. I would like to evolve to a Prusa MINI+ as my next 3D Printer.
printer.modeling: Modeling my own 3D models using Blender (since 2012) and SolidWorks
printer.slicing: Slicing and printing using Cura and PrusaSlicer
printer.controlling: Remotely controlling and monitoring using Octoprint with a Raspberry Pi 4

mods.title: Filament guide and Cables holder
mods.desc: Those 2 prints screwed on the X axis module improve filament feeding and cable organisation.

mods.title: Magnetic cooling fan holder
mods.desc: I printed this great 2 parts magnetic cooling fan holder. It provides easier access for filament change. It needed 8 tiny magnets so the 2 parts stick well.

mods.title: Printing bed adjusting screws
mods.desc: I printed those 4 enhanced adjusting screws to make fine tuning more confortable and precise than the orginal wing nuts. I put some oil so it rotates better.

mods.title: Power supply cover with power switch
mods.desc: I printed this large cover screwed around the power supply to hide its pins. I added a very useful power switch button.

mods.title: Mosfet holder
mods.desc: A print to hold the Mosfet upgrade on the frame of the printer. It is now mounted next to the motherboard.

mods.title: Printer feet
mods.desc: I 3D modeled and printed custom feet for my printer. There are 2 on the front and 2 on the back, they help reducing vibrations and wobbling effect on my prints.

mods.title: Spool wheels
mods.desc: I printed those 2 spool wheels with springs so the spool rotates smoothly when printing. It is not really reliable because it keeps letting the spool fall.

mods.title: Spool feet
mods.desc: I printed this famous spool holder. It needs 4 parts and 4 bearings on which the spool rolls, more reliable than the cheap spool holder provided in the box.

mods.title: T-Corners
mods.desc: I printed those 2 T-Corners to attach to the frame of the printer. It helps reducing the frame vibrations by reinforcing it.

mods.title: Semi fan duct
mods.desc: I printed this semi fan duct to improve nozzle and fuzed filament cooling. It greatly enhance print quality, a must have.

mods.title: Printing steps indicator
mods.desc: This print allows to monitor the step rotation of the filament feeding motor, to detect eventual malfunctions and monitor feeding flow.

functional.title: Shutter crank holder
functional.desc: A print I did to replace a broken shutter crank holder next to a window. I needed to edit the 3D model so I didn't need to replace the original screw.

functional.title: Key replica
functional.desc: A replica of a box key, it needed at least 4 prototypes to be identical to the original and fully functional, I have been using it almost daily for 2 years.

functional.title: Google Home Mini wall mount
functional.desc: A print I did to hold my Google Home Mini smart speaker on the wall, sticked using double-sided adhesive, added two Ikea Fixa pads for more stability.

functional.title: Ergonomic bottle opener
functional.desc: I printed this useful, confortable and robust bottle opener with 100% infill. I have been using it about more than fifty times and it is still brand new.

functional.title: Custom cable organiser
functional.desc: I 3D modeled and printed this custom cable organiser so the cables under my desk are fixed and they do not hang.

functional.title: Smartphone holder
functional.desc: I printed this useful phone holder so my phone stands in view. It needed some additionnal mass inside to cope with my heavy phone.

functional.title: Nozzles Case
functional.desc: I printed this useful nozzle case to store the different sizes. Now I cannot lose one of them anymore.

functional.title: Camera ball joint
functional.desc: I 3D modeled and printed this custom ball joint for my Xiaomi camera so it can rotate on 3 axes instead of just one. It has a hole to fix it on the wall with a screw.

functional.title: Cable holder
functional.desc: I printed this useful cable holder to hold up to 2 cables. I sticked it on the furniture next to my desk.

functional.title: Filament pin
functional.desc: I printed this useful filament pin to put on the spool, so the filament end does not move and get mixed up.

art.title: Fall Guys figurine
art.desc: An 8cm tall figurine printed in 3 parts of different colors, sticked together, the eyes are painted using a black marker.

art.title: Low Poly flower pot
art.desc: I printed this fancy Low Poly flower pot that blends greatly with my other pots. I added a hole on the bottom on the 3D model for water evacuation.

art.title: Minecraft crafting table
art.desc: I printed a 40x40mm empty cube to stick a papercraft model of the Minecraft crafting table around it. Thanks to this it won't get crushed anymore.

art.title: Tiny Benchy boat
art.desc: I printed this 12mm long Benchy to test my 3D printer ability to render details at very low scale. I used a 0.25mm nozzle, it gave pretty good results.

art.title: Big screw
art.desc: I printed this big screw originally for the Y axis belt tensioner but it was too short so I converted it to decoration.

art.title: XYZ Calibration cubes
art.desc: Those 10mm cubes are meant to be printed to test the printing quality and details. It also has a decorative aspect. Ranked from left to right in printing quality.

art.title: Minecraft Pickaxe
art.desc: I printed and sanded this small Minecraft pickaxe. It has a hole to use it as a keychain but I dont like to overload my key ring.

art.title: Coffee molecule
art.desc: This little print represents the caffeine molecule. It can also be used as a keychain but its shape is impractical.

art.title: Lego 2x2 replica
art.desc: I printed those 2 little 2x2 Lego blocks at the same scale as the original. It needs to be very close to the original to be used with real ones.

art.title: Mini figther jet
art.desc: I printed this mini realistic figther jet. The wings can be deployed and retract. It was printed in one piece

art.title: Mini Low Poly Animal Figurines
art.desc: I printed those 3 animal figurines in low poly style. There is a wolf, a little cat and a tiny rabbit. Those prints are very detailed and needed long print time.

art.title: Low Poly The Thinker statue
art.desc: I printed this low poly style The Thiker statue by Auguste Rodin. I wanted to be very detailed so it needed an important print time.

art.title: Git Logo
art.desc: I 3D modeled and printed this simple representation of the Git logo. I enabled the ironing setting for the top layer for better results.

art.title: QR Codes
art.desc: I generated and printed those 3 QR Codes using grey and black filament on top. It needed 2 prototypes before giving a good result (the one on top).

art.title: Mini tank turret
art.desc: This print represents the turret of the American M5A1 Stuart light tank. I wanted it to be very detailed so it took a while to print.

art.title: HP Omen logo
art.desc: I printed this logo to customise the back of my HP Omen laptop, but it turned out to be to too thick and impractical so I use it as decoration.

art.title: Mini pistol
art.desc: I printed this respresentation of the 1911 pistol at a very low scale, this 40mm print is of course dummy. It is just a decoration.
